page.title: 20WETHERBY - STAY IN LEEDS ?
page.content: Although the unbiased Commission decided in favour of the move into North Yorkshire, there are still many local councillors who believe we should remain under the control of Leeds City Council. These include many Tories on Leeds City Council who want Wetherby to remain in Leeds, because if Wetherby leaves they may never regain power- as Wetherby is a major Tory stronghold in the city. As well as the political arguments put forward there are several social and economic reasons for staying in the Leeds City area. These include transport, education and central planning, producing more efficient management of the area. In the Leeds area transport is subsidised resulting in cheap fares for old, young and unemployed people. Leeds also has a better pupil/teacher ratio.
